page.title: 20OLD BUILDINGS IN WILSDEN
page.content: Towards the bottom of the Main Street is the old Manor House. Above the door the date the house was built can be clearly seen _ 1684. All the windows are very small and some of them have been bricked up. This was due to a window tax that was imposed soon after the house was built. The house is built out of local sandstone, as is the old barn at the back. Near the top of the village by the Ling Bob public house is Providence Mill. It was built in 1840. The workers cottages are close by the mill and so is the mill masters house. Further down Main Street from Manor House is the Old Smithy. It was built in 1790 and is still in use today. Horses are still taken to the village smithy for shoeing.
